You were asked on cross-examination about public statements you made in your name. A. Yes. Q. Do you recall that? A. Yes. Q. Was that hearing where you made those public statements about Maxwell? A. Sorry. I can't hear you. Q. Was that hearing where you made those public statements about Maxwell? A. No, it was not. Q. Who was the hearing about? A. It was about Jeffrey Epstein. Q. At that hearing, did you talk about all of your experiences? A. No. Q. Did you go into detail about your experiences with Epstein during that hearing? A. No. Q. Why not? A. Because I did not want to disclose on a public level under my own name the details of the incidents that took place because I did not want my daughter to be exposed. SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00012886

statements that you made in your name. Do you recall that? A. Can you repeat? Q. You were asked on cross-examination about public statements you made in your name. A. Yes. Q. Do you recall that? A. Yes. Q. Was that hearing where you made those public statements about Maxwell? A. Sorry. I can't hear you. Q. Was that hearing where you made those public statements about Maxwell? A. No, it was not. Q. Who was the hearing about? A. It was about Jeffrey Epstein. Q. At that hearing, did you talk about all of your experiences? A. No. Q. Did you go into detail about your experiences with Epstein during that hearing? A. No. Q. Why not? A. Because I did not want to disclose on a public level under my own name the details of the incidents that took place because I did not want my daughter to be exposed.
